title: Don't error our when encountering unsupported GetInfo-options
Fix warnings with newer rustc. When dropping values, drop() has to be explicitly called
Rename and document `U2FAPDUHeader` and fix Nc=0 (main branch)
body:
Addresses #190 on the `main` branch. The issues described here also affect the `ctap2-2021` branch (see #189).

* Fixes an issue where Lc bytes would be included when Nc = 0 (zero command data length). This is incorrect in ISO 7816-4:2005 (which FIDO v1.1 and v1.2 correctly describe).

  This affected the `GetVersion` command; and tests have been updated accordingly.

* Renames `U2FAPDUHeader` to `CTAP1RequestAPDU`.

  Using the name "CTAP1" rather than "U2F" follows the convention put forward in FIDO v2.x specs, which avoids confusion like "U2Fv2" = "CTAP1".

  The previous implementation wasn't just "a header", but rather the complete APDU.

* Renames `FidoDevice::send_apdu` to `FidoDevice::send_ctap1`. This makes it more like `RequestCtap2`, and avoids confusion later on when adding support for CTAP2 over NFC (which still uses ISO 7816-4 APDUs).

* Documents and add tests for `CTAP1RequestAPDU`, explaining the confusing state of affairs.

title: Fix #187: Do not truncate leading zeros when printing AAGuid
Serialize attestation as webauthn
body:
This depends on PR #185 and tries to solve #183:

We deserialize from CTAP-format and serialize to webauthn-format.

This also simplifies the C-API a lot, with the only downside of needing to pass in the "force none attestation"-option.

If the token only speaks CTAP1, but the incoming user-request was 'CTAP2', this already works, thanks to #185. Only the pure CTAP1-case returns the raw data at the moment, and I think that case may go away entirely anyways.

title: Implement parsing of DER-certificate length and remove AttestationStatement::Unparsed()
body:
Instead of pulling in a new dependency to parse DER-format, we can do a lightweight parsing of only the first few bytes, to get the length of the certificate, in order to split the buffer into cert and signature.
The C-API currently has no way to copy out those individually, yet.

title: Fix #182: Return the actual serialized byte-array of the used client-data alonside the struct itself.
Relax keylength checks for CTAP2 and implement excludeList-support for CTAP1
body: Looks bigger than it is. Mostly refactoring out some longer things to reuse them, and adding a new test-binary to check the excludeList-feature.

title: Remove unneeded explicit close-call, since the file will be close automatically
body: This is a forgotten leftover when switching to storing `File`s directly instead of file-handles. This is not needed at all.

title: Bump tokio to 1.17, which is current version in mozilla-central
Add device ping on open (from NetBSD) to FreeBSD
body: This prevents the annoying freezes in `read()`.

title: Bump base64 and switch off default-features of nom for vendoring in m-c
CI - Manual rust install
body: Since actions-rs are not allowed under mozilla, install Rust by hand.

title: Use memoffset instead of homebrew offset_of
body:
This was generating warnings/errors because the homebrew macro dereferences a null pointer and produces a reference to an unaligned field.

memoffset's implementation does this in a way that doesn't rely on UB (when building with rust >=1.51).

title: Fix stub and make NSS compile on 32bit systems
Bump sha2-version
body: mozilla-central has a newer sha2-crate vendored

title: Reset and setpin commands
body:
Add two new commands (not yet exposed via C-API) and fix a few bugs along the way. Most notably the NSS-encryption bug. 
This PR looks bigger than it actually is, because a lot of copy-paste-refactoring of functions and examples.

title: Do not error out if the token returns options unknown to us
body:
This might happen, if the token is very new and supports a newer CTAP-specification.
In that case, we simply don't support it, but shouldn't error out.

title: Device selection
body:
Implement device selection, in case multiple devices are plugged in.

It is another big one, but the individual commits should be rather self-contained and easy to follow.

Big picture:
Introduced a new class, that gets created for each transaction. It will start its own thread, where an even loop is running. 
The devices run each their own thread, as well as the device monitor (as was before), but send messages to that even loop, which will then decide what to do and send commands back to the devices.

Note 1: I don't have the infra set up to compile on mac or windows, so those are best efforts. (The BSDs are currently still all broken)
Note 2: There probably is a race condition in the Mac monitor code, because I don't get all devices at the beginning in one package, but only via callbacks, which might lead to some devices being 'ignored' by the code. There probably is a way to get the list of plugged in devices from the iokit-SDK, but I'm not really a iOS-dev, nor do I have the hardware to test it.

title: Update warp and tokio
body:
This updates warp to 0.3.2 and tokio to 1.0. These libraries are only used for
testing. This update should help prevent duplicated copies of tokio when
vendoring into mozilla-central.

title: Update application-services dependency to v84.0.0
body:
Same as is vendored in mozilla-central, so that we can use this repo for vendoring.
The already vendored packages where updated while this branch was in review.

title: Add riscv64 support
body: To generate riscv64 code, rust-bindgen have to be updated due to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-bindgen/pull/1878. risc64's rust target is risc64gc-*, but clang doesn't accept this target name since correct is riscv64, not riscv64gc.

title: Fix panic msg is not a string literal warning
